message.content:
{"id": "12906", "title": "Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Cannot open a file in multiple editors simultaneously", "description": "Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If a file is already opened in one editor, attempting to open it in another editor should display an error message. However, in the current state, no warning or error message is displayed and the file cannot be opened in multiple editors.", "OB": "The file can be opened in the workbench in one editor.", "EB": "When attempting to open the file in another editor, a warning message should be displayed indicating that the file is already opened and asking if the user wants to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed stating that all file instances need to be closed before opening. This is a safety feature implemented in WSAD to prevent external editing when the file is already opened in WSAD.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue:
1. Open a java file in the workbench by double-clicking on it.
2. Right-click on the same java file and select 'Open With... System Editor'.

Expected result:
A warning message should be displayed informing the user that the file is already opened and asking if they want to continue.

Alternative expected result:
An error message should be displayed stating that all file instances need to be closed before opening in another editor."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '12906', 'title': 'Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)', 'description': 'Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg) ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': "Make sure you have an assoicate Windows editor for your java file.Ifnot, go to the file explorer, double click on any java file, and selectWordPad or notepadas default editor for all java files.In the Java Perspective, right click on the Java fileOpen With ..System Editor.A notepad and wordpad window will pop up with the javafile opened. Close it.go to the Java Perspective, open a java file by simply double clickingon it.The file is now opened in the workbench.Now right click on the Java fileOpen With .. System Editor.Nothing happens.The workbench should be warning message saying thatyou may overwrite changes... and do you want to continue?or errormessage saying that theh should close all file first.We believe it's a safety feature where WSAD doesn't allow externalediting while the file is already opened in WSAD. "}
